Interested to join Jewelry Industry and be a professional Diamond Grader? Due to our aggressive expansion, we are hiring a large group of Diamond Graders to meet our high production requirements.

Come build a unique career as a Diamond Grader Associate in GIA Hong Kong Laboratory. You will work with diamonds, microscopes and computers in a laboratory production environment that emphasizes detail, quality and precision.

Evaluate and grade loose diamonds. Identify, documents and plot characteristics, treatments and other features of a diamond.
Work in a team setting with other graders of various skill levels.
Performed detailed evaluations using tools such as a microscope, a loupe, tweezers and a computer.

Diploma or above required with fluent English.
No relevant education or working experience required.

Detail-minded with good concentration skills. 
Effective communication and good interpersonal skills is a must. 
Ability to get along with a diverse group of individuals in Hong Kong and other international locations. 
Proven ability to accept and learn from constructive criticism. 
Well organized, responsible, mature & ability to work independently.

description:
Job Highlights

Exciting vacancy in a truly global and dynamic company, with potential for growth to managerial level position in coloured stones department
5-day working week

Job Description

International Gemological Institute (IGI) is the largest organisation of its kind, operating 18 laboratory locations around the world, grading finished jewellery, natural diamonds, lab-grown diamonds and gemstones - and 14 schools of gemology, graduating thousands of new jewellery professionals each year. 

IGI is the only worldwide gemological institute focusing on consumer protection by evaluating and grading finished jewellery creations, as well as loose diamonds and coloured gemstones. 

IGI Worldwide’s Hong Kong laboratory, which was established in 2004, is looking for an experienced COLOURED STONES GRADER to join its dynamic team of gemological professionals.

The ideal candidate will have:

A minimum of 5 years experience in a senior coloured stones grading role in reputed international gemological laboratory
GG – FGA – DGA qualifications (or equivalent)
Good command of / experience in gemstone origin determination based on microscopic analysis
A keen interest in gemology and its related fields
Good command of spoken and written English and Chinese
